context: Tests whether the agent implements multilingual greeting support with the correct 5 languages, uses config-driven greeting strings matching the skill's specified values, and defaults to English for unrecognized locales.

checklist.name: English greeting string
checklist.description: The English greeting contains 'Hello! Welcome to the Tessl ecosystem.' or a string closely matching the config-specified value

checklist.name: French greeting string
checklist.description: The French greeting contains 'Bonjour' and references Tessl or the ecosystem in French

checklist.name: Spanish greeting string
checklist.description: The Spanish greeting contains 'Hola' and references Tessl or the ecosystem in Spanish

checklist.name: German greeting string
checklist.description: The German greeting contains 'Hallo' and references Tessl or the ecosystem in German

checklist.name: Japanese greeting string
checklist.description: The Japanese greeting contains Japanese characters (e.g. こんにちは) and references Tessl

checklist.name: Exactly five languages
checklist.description: The configuration or module supports exactly the 5 languages: en, fr, es, de, ja — no more, no fewer

checklist.name: Config-driven strings
checklist.description: Greeting strings are stored in a config/data file (e.g. JSON) and loaded by the module, NOT hardcoded inline in function logic

checklist.name: English as default
checklist.description: When an unsupported language code is provided, the module falls back to the English greeting

checklist.name: Default language specified
checklist.description: The config or code explicitly identifies 'en' as the default language (via a field, constant, or comment)

checklist.name: Fallback demonstration
checklist.description: The test/demo script calls the function with at least one unsupported language code to demonstrate fallback behavior
